ygData.subject: Re: [EverQuest] OT: Buyer Beware! "copy protected CDs".
ygData.msgSnippet: Gotta love progress ha ha ha ha (sarcasic....very sarcatic tone there) ... Join the world’s largest e-mail service with MSN Hotmail. Click Here
ygData.messageBody:
Gotta love "progress" ha ha ha ha (sarcasic....very sarcatic tone there)

>From: "The Mad Macinchaote"
>Reply-To: EverQuest@yahoogroups.com
>To:
>Subject: Re: [EverQuest] OT: Buyer Beware! "copy protected CDs".
>Date: Wed, 5 Jun 2002 12:39:27 -0400
>
>I've seen that...it damages the Open Firmware on a lot of newer Macs. Charming, huh?
> ----- Original Message -----
> From: Su
> To: LHML@yahoogroups.com ; nlml@yahoogroups.com ; robintheboywonder@yahoogroups.com ; EverQuest@yahoogroups.com ; Spellbinders@yahoogroups.com ; BLUDHAVEN@yahoogroups.com
> Sent: Wednesday, June 05, 2002 12:23 PM
> Subject: [EverQuest] OT: Buyer Beware! "copy protected CDs".
>
>
> A friend just passed this info along and I felt strongly enough about it to
> pass it along to everyone because I detest anything that crashes computers
> and wanted to make everyone aware of this new stupidity.
> http://uk.eurorights.org/issues/cd/docs/celdion.shtml
>
> Basically, the "CD"s listed will not only not play, but they can crash your
> computer and cause damage. I understand that record companies don't want
> songs being ripped, but the only CD player I use is in my computer. Some
> companies just amaze me with their stupidity. Their form of copy protection
> is just not the way to go.
> At least Philips is taking the more consumer friendly approach.
> http://news.com.com/2100-1023-817937.html
>
> Anyways, just wanted to share.
> luv,
> -Su
>
>
